column5: Last week was the first time I have gone drift fishing... We hit the Lower Niagara in the morning and spent a couple of hours running back and forth drifting with Minnows and Roe...  Steve managed to boat a couple of fish, however since Lakers are out of season I can not attach any pictures... They went right back in the water to swim another day.  There were about 6 other boats out there with us.  As the day slowed down I noted that everyone even the shore fishermen were catching fish... Not only was the fishing amazing, the sceanery was spectacular.  The almost in the boat shot... lol... maybe next time.   Cheers, Jen
By the look of that rod, you got into a fair tussle.  Sometimes the remote releases are the best for your Cand R fish.  Thanks for your report!
WTG Jen, sounds like a fun day!
Looks cold out there your camera lens fogged abit. I see the trees are in all thier colors. Thansk for the report

Nice report Jen !!! and yes the scenery is fantastic...  ..well other than lakers what did you catch?????...the mighty niagara is tops on my list for next year as i havnt fished it yet,so im looking forward to that fishing trip big time....cheers
Ahhhh!... So close, yet so far....   Thanks for posting Jen... you'll get'em next time!!!
great pics thanks for sharing ,what kinda boat is that I love CC

give it a little time and the river will be on fire....we are about to get some snow down here and that will drop the water temp and the fish will run up stream....a couple more weeks I would say....ther are fish in the river just not the late fall numbers as usual..... nice pics by the way!
Im running a 18ft Limestone CC  ..this boat is very stable and sweet for drift fishing the lower Niagara..Next time jen ill grab the net instead of the camera lol..
Great report Jen...and as far as I'm concerned, you landed that fish.  If it gets that far then you just intentionally released it in the water so you wouldn't stress is out even more.
Well if thats the case, then I "caught" my pb lake trout... LOL... I like your way of thinking Cliff and am changing mine to suit!
